info.title: Wildfitter Documentation
info.description: This is the documentation for the new Wildfitter REST api. To start using the requests click the `Run in postman` button located on the top right corner of the page, then the postman desktop app will be open with the collection loaded.

get.description:
`api.activities.get_activities`

Search through activities.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Filter activity created BEFORE that date. Received as timestamp.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Filter activity created AFTER that date. Received as timestamp.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: Filter on activity group (separated by commas).

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filter on activity type (create/update/delete).

parameters.name: is-triage
parameters.description: Filter activities for admin triage. Will return only activities that require mandatory admin inspection.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: Only include activities performed on this profile

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Only include activities performed by this profile

parameters.name: outfitter
parameters.description: Include activities related to this outfitter

parameters.name: brand
parameters.description: Include activities related to this brand

parameters.name: association
parameters.description: Include activities related to this association

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Include activities related to this generic vendor

parameters.name: review
parameters.description: Only Include activities related to this review

parameters.name: verification
parameters.description: Only include activities regarding this Profile Verification

parameters.name: album
parameters.description: Include activities related to this album

get.description:
`api.activities.get_activity`

Get a single activity. Only Lambda apps with admin token can access.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Id of the activity to retreive

get.description:
`api.exports.get_vendors`

Search vendors and get all results in a CSV

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The Type of vendor (e.g. 60 for Conservation Groups or 51 for Federal Government). Separated by commas if more than 1

parameters.name: insider-category
parameters.description: The Insider Category that's opened when user is an employee of the vendor

parameters.name: insider-type
parameters.description: The Insider Type that's opened when user is an employee of the vendor

parameters.name: has-domain
parameters.description: Filter vendors depending if they have one or more corporate domains set

parameters.name: ffl-expired
parameters.description: Only when types=22. Filter vendors based on the FFL expiration date

parameters.name: has-ffl
parameters.description: Only when types=22. Filter vendors that have (or not) the FFL file uploaded on GF

parameters.name: dealership
parameters.description: Only for types 21 and 22 (dealers). Pass the brand IDs separated by comma

Logs a sent notification. `profile`, `type`, `token` properties are required

get.description:
`api.brands.get_brands`

Returns a list of brands. The only public filters are `q` and `profile-status`. Sort order is ignored when the `q` parameter is set, and instead results are sorted by match relevance.

parameters.name: profile-status
parameters.description: The status of the profile (online/offline/any) (online by default)

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Include soft deleted profiles in the search (yes/no/any) (no by default)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description:
Filter by country or state. The Geoname ID of the GeoEntities separated by commas, or '0' to filter those without a location.
Also those values are possible 'midwest', 'south', 'east', 'west'

post.description:

Creates a brand, its profile, and its GOP.

grid_enabled.description: Enable/disable the grid capabilities of that brand + show programs in cockpit (only admins)

with.description: The extra fields you want in the returned JSON

requestBody.description: The brand object that will be updated.

url.description: Brand website URL (not GOP, general public URL)

account_manager.description: The Profile ID of the GF admin that's managing this account (admins only)

anniversary.description: The ISO date of the brand's Grid anniversary (admins only)

grid_agreement.description: The file name of the Grid Agreement template already uploaded on guidefitterconfidential S3 bucket (admins only)

prostaff_status.description: Set status of the Pro Staff Program, 0=locked, 1=closed, 2=opened

prostaff_shop_status.description: Set magento shop status for the Pro Staff, 1=created, 2=opened (admins only)

prostaff_duration.description: Set status of the Pro Staff membership default duration, null=everlasting, 1=6m, 2=1y

prostaff_agreement.description: The file name of the Pro Staff Agreement template already uploaded on guidefitterconfidential S3 bucket

aim_status.description: Set status of the AIM Program, 0=locked, 1=closed, 2=opened

aim_shop_status.description: Set magento shop status for AIM, 1=created, 2=opened (admins only)

price_date.description: The date when pricing was last updated. If NULL it'll default to current date/time

inventory_date.description: The date when inventory was last updated. If NULL it'll default to current date/time.

name.description: The Brand Profile name (that'll be his Guidefitter URL)

avatar.description: The ID of the photo to use as profile avatar

cover.description: The ID of the photo to use as profile cover

notifications.description: The list of notifications IDs the brand is subscribed to

grid_enabled.description: Enable/disable the grid capabilities of that brand + show programs in cockpit (only admins)

with.description: The extra fields you want in the returned JSON

parameters.description: Id of the brand

get.description:
`api.brands.get_brand_statistics`

Returns brand program statistics. 3 objects in the response:
- 'yearly' contains the yearly stats
- 'monthly' contains the monthly stats for the last 12 months
- 'daily' contains the daily stats for the last 6 months


Mapping for keys:
- m > members
- mn > members_new
- v > visits
- s > shopping
- r > revenue
- g > gross
- c > comsn
- o > nborders

parameters.name: brandId
parameters.description: Id of the brand

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Year to fetch stats for. If ommited it'll use current year

200.description: Three objects with yearly, weekly, and daily statistics

yearly.description:
Get all the brand programs statistics.
3 objects in the response:
- "today" contains the latest stats
- "monthly" contains the monthly stats for the last 12 months
- "daily" contains the daily stats for the last 6 months


Mapping for keys:
- m > members
- mn > members_new
- v > visits
- s > shopping
- r > revenue
- g > gross
- c > comsn
- o > nborders

get.description:
`api.discountcodes.get_discountcodes`

Returns a list of discount codes. For managers, the `brand` parameter is mandatory. For insiders, the `program` parameter (gop, idp, ...etc) is mandatory.

parameters.name: brand
parameters.description: The brand ID (required for managers)

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: To filter the codes that the user can use (the ones assigned to him and the ones not assigned to anyone)

parameters.name: gop
parameters.description: The GOP ID for which the code is valid (required for Pros)

parameters.name: idp
parameters.description: The IDP ID for which the code is valid (required for Brand Employees)

parameters.name: cnp
parameters.description: The CNP ID for which the code is valid (required for NGO Employees)

parameters.name: oep
parameters.description: The OEP ID for which the code is valid (required for Government Employees)

parameters.name: mip
parameters.description: The MIP ID for which the code is valid (required for Military)

parameters.name: frp
parameters.description: The FRP ID for which the code is valid (required for First Responders)

parameters.name: ecp
parameters.description: The ECP ID for which the code is valid (required for Educators)

parameters.name: rtp
parameters.description: The RTP ID for which the code is valid (required for Retail Employees)

parameters.name: dealer
parameters.description: Vendor ID. Filter discount codes that have been checked or used at that dealer

post.description:
`api.discountcodes.create_discountcode`

For admins and brand managers: create a discount code. `owner` and `code` fields are required. Examples:
- To create a global code for all shops/programs: {'code': 'XXXXX'}
- To create a global code for Zeiss GOP: {'code': 'XXXXX', 'brand': 6, 'gop': 6}
- To create a personal code for a Zeiss Pro member: {'code': 'XXXXX', 'brand': 6, 'gop': 6, 'user': 1234}

owner.description: The profile ID of the brand this code belongs to (required if not admin)

code.description: The discount code itself (will be trimmed) (max 100 chars)

description.description: A small description of what the code gives (max 150 chars)

expiration_date.description: The date when the code will automatically expire

use_date.description: The date when the code was used

brand.description: The ID of the brand this code applies to

gop.description: The ID of the GOP this code applies to. Means members of brand's GOP can then use that code.

idp.description: The ID of the IDP this code applies to. Means members of brand's IDP can then use that code.

frp.description: The ID of the FRP this code applies to. Means members of brand's FRP can then use that code.

oep.description: The ID of the EOP this code applies to. Means members of brand's EOP can then use that code.

cnp.description: The ID of the CNP this code applies to. Means members of brand's CNP can then use that code.

ecp.description: The ID of the ECP this code applies to. Means members of brand's ECP can then use that code.

rtp.description: The ID of the RTP this code applies to. Means members of brand's RTP can then use that code.

mip.description: The ID of the MIP this code applies to. Means members of brand's MIP can then use that code.

with.description: The extra fields you want in the returned JSON

get.description:
`api.discountcodes.get_discountcode`

For dealers: get the insider information attached to a discount code. Only searches 'assigned' discount codes

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The discount code to retreive

parameters.name: brandId
parameters.description: Brand id of the code to retreive

put.description:
`api.discountcodes.claim_discountcode`

For insiders: claim a discount code previously created by admins or brand managers. We will check the insider category of the insider and fetch an existing unclaimed code for his program. The insider can then get his discount codes from route api.discountcodes.get_discountcodes (but the codes will also be in the response to this call)

parameters.name: brandId
parameters.description: Brand id of the code to retreive

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of codes to claim (default 1)

parameters.name: codeId
parameters.description: The ID of the discount code to delete

parameters.name: hard
parameters.description: To hard-delete the code (admins only, default false)

parameters.name: codeId
parameters.description: The ID of the discount code to delete

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The ID of the discount code Target to delete

get.description:
`api.comments.get_comments`

Returns a list of comments.
Pivot pagination: the `pivot` parameter is the timestamp (insertedOn) of the comment making the pivot with the next page.
If sorting is `new` (default), it'll return comments before the pivot in chronological order.
If sorting is `old`, it'll return comments after the pivot in chronological order.
If sorting is `best`, there's no chronology so no pivot pagination, use `page` param.
With pivot pagination, `meta` will contain a prop `countNext` to know how many more comments there are after (before) the pivot comment.
If starting pagination from a comment in the middle, add the prop _pivot_prev to the query string to also get a `prev` URL in meta and start a reverse pagination.

parameters.name: pivot
parameters.description: The extra fields you want in the returned JSON

get.description:
`api.trackings.create_tracking`

Adds a Tracking. Tracking types are:
- odp: Outfitter Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the outfitter)
- mdp: Member Details Page (eid is the profile ID of the user)
- phone: Outfitter Phone (eid is the profile ID of the outfitter)
- godp: GOP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- iddp: IDP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- cndp: CNP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- oedp: OEP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- midp: MIP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- frdp: FRP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- ecdp: ECP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- rtdp: RTP Detail Page (eid is the profile ID of the brand)
- review_view: Public Review Page (eid is the review ID)
- review_scroll: Public Review Page (eid is the review ID)
- review_thank: Public Review Page (eid is the review ID)
- review_share: Public Review Page (eid is the review ID)
- review_comment: Public Review Page (eid is the review ID)
- review_bait: Public Review Page, CTA clicked (eid is the review ID)
- review_hook: Public Product Page, Added to cart (eid is the review ID)
- review_buy: Checkout, Product purchased (eid is the review ID)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The tracking type (what are we tracking)

_u.description: The ID of the user we're tracking (null if not signed in)

_rf.description: Referer: the absolute URL to the referer page

_ua.description: User Agent: the user agent string from the browser

eid.description: The entity ID we're tracking (e.g. profile ID, article ID, review ID...etc)

Updates multiple photos.

photos.description: An array of photo IDs (100 photos max)

location.description: An array with 'name' of the location where the photo was taken, and 'lat' and 'lon' for GPS coordinates (optional)

product_type.description: The list of activities (ProductType entity) the outfitter is offering

taken_date.description: The date when the photo was taken (UTC timezone)

move_up.description: The ID of the album in which to move the photo(s) UP

move_down.description: The ID of the album in which to move the photo(s) UP

profile.description: The profile ID the photo belongs to

filename.description: The uploaded file name on the S3 upload bucket (e.g. 'Image 01.JPEG')

type.description: What the photo will be used for (standard/avatar/facebook/cover/brag/review)

private.description: The photo will be private and not published on profile public page or feed

public.description: The photo will be public and published on profile public page or feed (default TRUE)

album.description: The ID of the album where to place the photo

album_cover.description: Only if we have 'album', we'll also set the photo as cover of the album

brag_category.description: Required for a type=brag, the outfitting type to tag the brag with

crop_x.description: When original photo is cropped, the X coordinate (relative to original photo)

crop_y.description: When original photo is cropped, the Y coordinate (relative to original photo)

crop_w.description: When original photo is cropped, the crop width (relative to original photo)

crop_h.description: When original photo is cropped, the crop height (relative to original photo)

with.description: The extra fields you want in the returned JSON

post.description:
`api.photos.create_photo`

Triggers processing of photo (Lambdas) and creating photo entity in database. `profile` field is true.
- Photo for Feed: {'profile': 123, 'filename': 'Image 1.PNG', 'type': 'standard'} (then call api.posts.create_post using 'photo')
- Photo for Story: {'profile': 123, 'filename': 'Image 1.PNG', 'album': 456, 'type': 'standard'} (album is the story photo album)
- Profile avatar: {'profile': 123, 'filename': 'Image 1.PNG', 'type': 'avatar', 'crop_x': 120, 'crop_y': 5, 'crop_w': 255, 'crop_h': 255} (then call e.g. api.users.update_user to update 'avatar')
- Facebook avatar: {'profile': 123, 'type': 'facebook'} (then call e.g. api.users.update_user to update 'avatar')
- Profile cover: {'profile': 123, 'filename': 'Image 1.PNG', 'type': 'cover', 'crop_x': 120, 'crop_y': 5, 'crop_w': 1920, 'crop_h': 800} (then call e.g. api.outfitters.update_outfitter to update 'cover')
- Customer avatar: {'profile': 123, 'filename': 'Image 1.PNG', 'type': 'avatar', 'private': true, 'crop_x': 120, 'crop_y': 5, 'crop_w': 255, 'crop_h': 255} (then call api.customers.update_customer to update 'avatar')
- Photo for Brag: {'profile': 123, 'filename': 'Image 1.PNG', 'type': 'brag', 'brag_category': 10, 'crop_x': 120, 'crop_y': 5, 'crop_w': 600, 'crop_h': 600, 'animals': [1001, 2001], 'profiles': [4325, 4328], 'tags': ['nofilter', 'hunting-sunday']}

profile.description: The profile ID the photo belongs to

filename.description: The uploaded file name on the S3 upload bucket (e.g. 'Image 01.JPEG')

type.description: What the photo will be used for (standard/avatar/facebook/cover/brag/review)

private.description: The photo will be private and not published on profile public page or feed

public.description: The photo will be public and published on profile public page or feed (default TRUE)

album.description: The ID of the album where to place the photo

album_cover.description: Only if we have 'album', we'll also set the photo as cover of the album

brag_category.description: Required for a type=brag, the outfitting type to tag the brag with

crop_x.description: When original photo is cropped, the X coordinate (relative to original photo)

crop_y.description: When original photo is cropped, the Y coordinate (relative to original photo)

crop_w.description: When original photo is cropped, the crop width (relative to original photo)

crop_h.description: When original photo is cropped, the crop height (relative to original photo)

with.description: The extra fields you want in the returned JSON

photos.description: An array of phoro IDs (100 photos max)

other_vendor.description: When vendor is null, the brand the insider says he's working for

To reuse an old document in case of renewal, pass 'document' with the document ID of the old document to copy

Returns ALL groups/species/subspecies reference in an online hunting/fishing product.
The response is different in that it won't return entities but just raw DB data to build the page:
- animal_group_id: the ID of the group the animal belong to
- animal_ref_id: the ID of the animal (if same as animal_group_id it's a group)

- hash: the URL key to build link to the SRP

get.description:
`api.threads.get_thread_messages`

Returns thread messages. Pivot pagination: the `pivot` parameter is the timestamp of the message making the pivot with the next page. If sorting is `new` (default), it'll return messages before the pivot in chronological order. If sorting is `old`, it'll return messages after the pivot in chronological order.

`meta` will contain a prop `countNext` to know how many more messages there are after/before the pivot message.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: Id of the thread to get messages of

parameters.name: pivot
parameters.description: he timestamp of a message to use as pivot in pagination
